content:
ICS 1C HW 3

Some information about me.

Name: Anil Kapur
E-mail: easu1345@ea.oac.uci.edu
Major: Economics

Here are few intresting finds I liked!!

  1. NASA pictures and images of space!!
  2. Different public polls and surveys!
  3. NBA standings and stats!

Five questions I can now answer!
  1. What are the requirements for a masters in Management?
  2. What upper division classes are required for an Economics major?
  3. How can multimedia enhance computers?
  4. How important is the WWW for me?
  5. What can I do at Club Med?
  1. What are the requirements for a masters in Management?

    A couple of years ago, I was sitting around one day wondering about what I want to do in the future. So after deciding not to pursue a future in Engineering, I figured the Buisness market was the way I wanted to go. Now the question was how?.

    I decided the easiest way was to Major in Economics, Minor in Management and try to get a MBA after I graduated. The Social Sciences Dept. at UCI was very helpful, but I still needed some inofrmation on how to get my MBA. While searching the Web I found a wonderful home page through the Univ. of Texas. The Graduate School home page allowed me to find some helpful information. Such as the basic five factors that will help me enter good Graduate school.

    The five factors are:
    1. GPA
    2. Test scores on the LSAT, GMAT, or GRE
    3. Recommendation letters
    4. Extracurricular activities
    5. Work experience

    Out of these five factors I have found out that Work Experience tends to be one of the most important factors which Grad schools look at. I was also able to find other important helpful, information through the home page. Like me if you just click on Graduate School you can find out more information.

    Return to list of questions.

  2. What upper division classes are required for an Economics major?

    Before I can get my MBA, I have to make sure I graduate from UCI with all the required requirements completed. In order to gradute with an Econmics major, besides the breath requirements one must complete all lower division and upper division Economic courses with passing grades.

    The easiest way to find information on courses without speaking to the staff. Would be to look at the Dept. of Econ. Course Catalog. I was able to find out that along with Econ 100A-B-C it is required that one must complete four additional upper-division courses of their choice. The four courses can be chosen from different catagories ranging from Quantitative Methods to Financial Economics.

    The only problem now is when should I take them and when are they offered? This question is not to hard to answer, because all that I have to do is look at the appopriate Scedule of Classes catalog.

    Return to list of questions.

  3. How can multimedia enhance computers?

    Multimedia is the use of graphics, sound, animation and video with the use of computers. The addition of multimedia to computers helps people search the web with a whole new experience. The idea of multimedia not only enhances a users experience, but opens up new paths to view.

    The new paths which appear, allow someone to access such things as: various graphical pictures, video files, and even NBA sports highlights. The use of multimedia allows a broader use of computers from schools as a learning experience to businesses as a tool to compete in a competitive market. So no matter who you are multimedia will help to enhance your experience with computers.

    Return to list of questions.

  4. How important is the WWW for me?

    The WWW plays an important role in the life of many people, including me. Without the web today it would be very difficult for people to find certain information. But with the advancement of the Information Super-Highway and the WWW I can acess information quicker than ever(and its easy too). As stated above multimedia has played a big part in the advancement of commputers, allowing one to view their documents and information with graphics and sound.

    I believe without me taking ICS 1C, I would never have learned so much about the web and it's features. With my new found knowledge I can now access various information through such servers as: Yahoo-A Guide to WWW and the ElNet Galaxy. Thus I would say that the WWW is very important to me!

    Return to list of questions.

  5. What can I do at Club Med?

    Club Med is one of today's hottest Vacation Resorts located through many tropical areas of the world. Whenever I thought of Club Med, I pictured a resort for adults only. But Club Med is a universal resort. Whether you are young or old, married or single, Club Med can be for you. Club Med features different types of villages such as friendship, romance, and togetherness.

    The Club Med philosophy is to give someone "endless amount of options" and they will be able to create their own perfect vacation. These options range from exotic sites to dream rooms to vast sporting activities.

    So no matter who you are and no matter what you want to do Club Med will try to provide you with the oppotunity to just do it.

    Return to list of questions.

Submitted February 14, 1995 for ICS 1C
